title: How to Make Grape Juice

steps.headline: Remove the grapes from their stems.
Wash the grapes.
steps.description: Put all the grapes in a colander and wash them in warm water until all the chemicals are washed off.

steps.headline: Mash the grapes.
steps.description: Use a potato masher until their juice begins to come out. An alternative to using a potato masher is to use a blender on pulse. Be sure not to blend them to a puree though.

steps.headline: Cook the grapes.
steps.description: Put the mashed grapes in a pot and cook them on medium heat for around 10 minutes. Mash up the grapes using a spoon or a potato masher if they start clumping up or retain their chunkiness.

steps.headline: Strain the juice.
steps.description: Put the sieve over a container or directly to a drinking glass. Pour the grapes into the sieve and then strain the mixture through. An alternative to using the sieve is using a cheesecloth. Put the cheesecloth over the pot and strain the mixture through (you might need to fold the cloth over twice). If you have a food mill, this would work beautifully.

steps.headline: Cool the juice.
steps.description: Remove the sieve or cheesecloth and put the juice in the refrigerator so it can cool, or pour the juice over ice in a drinking glass.
